> <OLD>
>
> Windlord frowned and said "This is the weirdest sight of all, a gorup of
> proto-humans wordshiping a Predacon"
>
>
> "I cannot said that, because I'm blind" muttered Perceptor
>
> Windlord payed more attention at the groling stones

<NEW>

Yes the humans, well the proto humans were falling down before a stone
statue carved in the likeness of BLIGHT, a most horrid and disgusting
PREDACON. BLIGHT was known to be an expert in biowarefare and the
technologies that make up transformers, but never as an object of
worship . . how disgusting!

As for the stones themselves, the ones that are being thrown in the
mouth of the statue, from what sensors indicate, they were giving off
some sort of radiation . It is difficult to tell what type of affect
the radiation is having on the humans since the ones that are handling
the stones are robed and covered in animal skins.

Once the stones enter into the mouth of the statue they quickly fell
down some sort of tube and  disappeared - presumably going underground
somewhere.

As WINDLORD and PERCEPTOR watched, the statue of BLIGHT darkened
slightly and then the optics stopped glowing as the mouth shut.

The Proto humans fall silent for a moment and then stood and turned
away as they began to walk back into the forest again.

One human stopped for a moment as if he sensed the MAXIMALS watching them.

(TAG)

- Preston
